intro: Valerianella olitoria var. dichotoma, commonly known as garden sorrel, is a leafy green plant native to Europe and western Asia. It features trifoliate leaves with a slightly sour taste due to its high concentration of oxalic acid. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, with slender, branching stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in cool climates and is often cultivated for its edible leaves. Botanically, it belongs to the Apiaceae family, sharing characteristics with other members like parsley and dill.
